segments.pli: Saṃyutta Nikāya 52
segments.en: Linked Discourses 52

segments.pli: 1. Rahogatavagga
segments.en: 1. In Private

segments.pli: 2. Dutiyarahogatasutta
segments.en: 2. In Private (2nd)

segments.pli: Sāvatthinidānaṃ.
segments.en: At Sāvatthī.

segments.pli: Atha kho āyasmato anuruddhassa rahogatassa paṭisallīnassa evaṃ cetaso parivitakko udapādi:
segments.en: Then as Anuruddha was in private retreat this thought came to his mind:

segments.pli: “yesaṃ kesañci cattāro satipaṭṭhānā viraddhā, viraddho tesaṃ ariyo maggo sammā dukkhakkhayagāmī;
segments.en: “Whoever has missed out on these four kinds of mindfulness meditation has missed out on the noble path to the complete ending of suffering.

segments.pli: yesaṃ kesañci cattāro satipaṭṭhānā āraddhā, āraddho tesaṃ ariyo maggo sammā dukkhakkhayagāmī”ti.
segments.en: Whoever has undertaken these four kinds of mindfulness meditation has undertaken the noble path to the complete ending of suffering.”

segments.pli: Atha kho āyasmā mahāmoggallāno āyasmato anuruddhassa cetasā cetoparivitakkamaññāya—seyyathāpi nāma balavā puriso samiñjitaṃ vā bāhaṃ pasāreyya, pasāritaṃ vā bāhaṃ samiñjeyya; evameva—āyasmato anuruddhassa sammukhe pāturahosi. Atha kho āyasmā mahāmoggallāno āyasmantaṃ anuruddhaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: Then Venerable Mahāmoggallāna knew what Venerable Anuruddha was thinking. As easily as a strong person would extend or contract their arm, he reappeared in front of Anuruddha and said to him:

segments.pli: “kittāvatā nu kho, āvuso anuruddha, bhikkhuno cattāro satipaṭṭhānā āraddhā hontī”ti?
segments.en: “Reverend Anuruddha, how do you define the undertaking of the four kinds of mindfulness meditation by a mendicant?”

segments.pli: “Idhāvuso, bhikkhu ajjhattaṃ kāye kāyānupassī viharati ātāpī sampajāno satimā, vineyya loke abhijjhādomanassaṃ.
segments.en: “Reverend, it’s when a mendicant meditates by observing an aspect of the body internally—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.

segments.pli: Bahiddhā kāye kāyānupassī viharati … pe …
segments.en: They meditate observing an aspect of the body externally …

segments.pli: ajjhattabahiddhā kāye kāyānupassī viharati ātāpī sampajāno satimā, vineyya loke abhijjhādomanassaṃ.
segments.en: internally and externally—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.

segments.pli: Ajjhattaṃ vedanāsu vedanānupassī viharati ātāpī sampajāno satimā, vineyya loke abhijjhādomanassaṃ.
segments.en: They meditate observing an aspect of feelings internally …

segments.pli: Bahiddhā vedanāsu vedanānupassī viharati ātāpī sampajāno satimā, vineyya loke abhijjhādomanassaṃ.
segments.en: externally …

segments.pli: Ajjhattabahiddhā vedanāsu vedanānupassī viharati ātāpī sampajāno satimā, vineyya loke abhijjhādomanassaṃ.
segments.en: internally and externally …

segments.pli: Ajjhattaṃ citte … pe …
segments.en: They meditate observing an aspect of the mind internally …

segments.pli: bahiddhā citte … pe …
segments.en: externally …

segments.pli: ajjhattabahiddhā citte cittānupassī viharati ātāpī sampajāno satimā, vineyya loke abhijjhādomanassaṃ.
segments.en: internally and externally …

segments.pli: Ajjhattaṃ dhammesu … pe …
segments.en: They meditate observing an aspect of principles internally …

segments.pli: bahiddhā dhammesu … pe …
segments.en: externally …

segments.pli: ajjhattabahiddhā dhammesu dhammānupassī viharati ātāpī sampajāno satimā, vineyya loke abhijjhādomanassaṃ.
segments.en: internally and externally—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.

segments.pli: Ettāvatā kho, āvuso, bhikkhuno cattāro satipaṭṭhānā āraddhā hontī”ti.
segments.en: That’s how to define the undertaking of the four kinds of mindfulness meditation by a mendicant.”

segments.pli: Dutiyaṃ.

suttaplex.blurb: While meditating alone, Anuruddha reflected that one who has neglected the four kinds of mindfulness meditation has neglected the path to the end of suffering. Moggallāna reads his mind and visits to question him on this. Anuruddha speaks of developing the four kinds of mindfulness meditation internally and externally.
